title: Bethenny Frankel is optimistic about the future after leaving Real Housewives of New York City
text:
She announced she wouldn't be returning to The Real Housewives of New York City next season back in August.

And Bethenny Frankel spoke to Us Weekly about what's next for her in a new interview.

The 48-year-old Skinnygirl founder said she isn't sure what she had in mind for after her departure.

Glam: She announced she wouldn't be returning to The Real Housewives of New York City next season back in August

'I was planning to just breathe, but it was a chapter ending,' she told the outlet.

'It's very symbolic and poetic, but it really was a chapter ending, and it does feel like a completely clean slate, a new chapter.

'And I like the way it feels in many ways: in my family, in my humanitarian work, in my business, in my personal life, in my relationship, with everything, so it really does affect everything.

The reality star continued: 'I'm really excited because to leave something, you have to jump to fly, so I just made a decision and I made a good decision.'

Casual: The 48-year-old Skinnygirl founder said she isn't sure what she had in mind for after her departure

'I'm just focusing on the future and also spending more downtime for myself, looking at different properties, just breathing.

'I'm exhaling for the first time in a really long time. I had a really difficult year, and so I'm just exhaling for the first time in a while.'

The TV personality was an original cast member of the show at its debut in 2008.

On-screen: The TV personality was an original cast member of the show at its debut in 2008

Frankel is in the midst of working on several shows with Mark Burnett and helping launch Scruff-a-Luvs Real Rescue, an innovative new toy.

She's also working with the ASPCA to promote a free station where pet parents can get their dogs groomed for free at 424 E. 92nd Street in New York City from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.

'Being adopted is something very special. It's a choice, so I love that part about it. I love the message: saving lives,' she said.

Frankel shares nine-year-old daughter Bryn with ex-husband Jason Hoppy.
